item.title: Marie add a quote by George R. R. Martin
item.description: "Sleep is good, he said, And books are better." -- George R. R. Martin

item.title: Marie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Marie add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Marie add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Despite the enormous quantity of books, how few people read! And if one reads profitably, one would realize how much stupid stuff the vulgar herd is content to swallow every day." -- Voltaire

item.title: Marie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Imagine yourself as a living house. God comes in to rebuild that house. At first, perhaps, you can understand what He is doing. He is getting the drains right and stopping the leaks in the roof and so on; you knew that those jobs needed doing and so you are not surprised. But presently He starts knocking the house about in a way that hurts abominably and does not seem to make any sense. What on earth is He up to? The explanation is that He is building quite a different house from the one you thought of - throwing out a new wing here, putting on an extra floor there, running up towers, making courtyards. You thought you were being made into a decent little cottage: but He is building a palace. He intends to come and live in it Himself." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Marie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Marie add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Sometimes a journey makes itself necessary." -- Anne Carson
